titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Gaines, George W. Houk Jerrymiah Walker, Henry Combs, John Godsey, & Drury Godsey, Indictment
CWG5339

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Perry Circuit Court
The Commonwealth
agst } Indict
James Gaines, Geo. W. Houk Jerrymiah Walker, Henry Combs, John Godsey, Drury Godsey

The Grand Jury of Perry County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse James Gaines &c of the Crime of Murder committed as follows to wit: The said Thomas Gaines &c did in the county aforesaid on the 10th of Oct 1865 wilfully & Maliciously & unlawfully and with intent to Kill, not in their self defence Shoot at and wound James Thomas, with Guns & pistols of which wounds the said Thomas Died not Against the peace & dignity of the Comlth of Kentucky

Witness
James Thomas
Comlth
agst } Indict
Houk & others
James GainesMalisious Shooting
& wounding
